content.title: Innovapolis
content.subtitle: Innovapolis
content.description: Innovapolis is a home for pioneers and a place that sparks our collective imagination of what life in a regenerative, technologically advanced and culturally thriving society of the future could look like.

content.title: Society
content.subtitle: Agora
content.description: The agora is the center of the social and cultural life where people meet, debate, perform music & arts or celebrate. Automation in various sectors has the potential to pave the path to an age of freedom. But what will people do with their newfound freedom? What is the next fronteer? This is where the collective quest for meaning - the evolution of a new culture begins.

content.title: Economy
content.subtitle: Innovation District
content.description:
The village operates as a regenerative and highly automated economy that grants an unconditional coverage of basic needs and ensures that we remain within the planetary boundaries. 

Learn more: 
- Circular- and Sharing Economy
- Regenerative Finance & Tokenomics
- Automation Economy

content.title: Science & Education
content.subtitle: The Academy
content.description:
The Academy is a place for lifelong learning and personal development (cognitively, physically, emotionally and spiritually). For the young generation, there are playgrounds in nature and a school following a hybrid and holistic education approach.

Learn more: 
- Lifelong Learning
- Digital Education

content.title: Art & Music
content.subtitle: Art Quarter
content.description:
The Art District is a stimulating and vivid place with various small art ateliers, cultural cafés, exhibition spaces and a stage hosting plays & concerts. In the park, people read, paint, act, sing, play music or simply enjoy themselves.

Learn more: 
- Digital & AI-generated Artworks
- Metaverse Museum (Visual, performing & literary arts)

content.title: Food
content.subtitle: Regenerative Farm
content.description:
In the Regenerative Farm, people gather to cultivate and harvest organically grown food in the permaculture garden, food forest, vertical farm and in the dome-shaped greenhouse. These methods ensure a high level of biodiversity & soil health and demonstrate how food security is possible without the use of any pesticides and chemical fertilizers. While agriculture involved hard manual labor in the past, today much of the work can be automated thanks to agricultural robots, ground sensors, autonomous e-trucks and drones.

Learn more: 
- Permaculture
- Agroforestry
- Regenerative Field Farming
- Agricultural Robotics
- Soil Health
- Greenhouses & Airdomes
- Vertical Farming
- Aero-, Hydro-, and Aquaponics
- Plant-based and artificial Meat

content.subtitle: Philosopher's Temple
content.description:
At the top of a hill there is the philosopher’s temple. A place dedicated to all truth-seekers aiming to broaden their horizon and attaining wisdom. The place It inhabits a large library, an exhibition space about ancient civilizations & a philosopher’s café where lively and stimulation discussions are taking place. 

Learn more: 
- Meta-Modernism
- Automation Society
- Transhumanism

content.title: Space
content.subtitle: Observatory
content.description:
The highest point of the Village is a small observatory where you can marvel at the wonders of the night sky.

Learn more: 
- Space Exploration

content.title: Wellbeing
content.subtitle: Wellness Oasis
content.description:
Going up the Hill, you enter a new word. Surrounded by rocks and water - the Wellness Oasis “The Spring” connects you with your inner world and nature. Those seeking a quiet place for oneself, find it in the close by forrest with various cabins & tree huts.

Learn more: 
- Mental Health
- Yoga & Meditation
- Consciousness

content.title: Health
content.subtitle: Longevity Center
content.description:
The Longevity & Preventive health center supports you in becoming the healthiest and most vital version of yourself using breakthrough discoveries in digital health, med- and biotech.

Learn more: 
- Preventive Health
- Longevity
- Digital Health
- Medtech
- Biotech

content.title: Mobility
content.subtitle: Mobility Station
content.description:
The place can be reached by high-speed trains, electric or hydropowered public transport or flying e-cars. Cargo is being distributed via an underground transportation system. Since all the necessities of life are within walking distance, there is no need for personal cars within the village. 

Learn more: 
- Electric & Hydrogen Mobility
- Autonomous Vehicles
- Hyperloop
- Flying Vehicles
- Sharing Economy
- Underground Logistics System

content.title: Water
content.subtitle: Water Reservoir
content.description:
The drinking water mainly comes from the natural springs and the groundwater reserves. Since there is no use of toxic chemicals the water quality is at the highest level. 

Learn more: 
- Spring, Ground, and Lakewater
Greywater & Blackwater
- Circular Water System

content.title: Energy
content.subtitle: Renewable Energy Plant
content.description:
The village is powered with 100% renewable energy from solar panels, wind turbines, the hydro power plant and the local biogas facility. Households take on the role of “prosumers” by generating their own electricity and exchanging it via a smart neighborhood grid, leading to a higher level of resiliency. 
 Learn more: 
 Solar energy 
 Hydropower 
 Wind energy 
 Biomass

content.title: Data
content.subtitle: Data Center
content.description:
Inside the mountain there is a large datacenter with a quantum computer. Building the facility underground has many advantages such as protection, consistent temperatures and higher energy efficiency.

Learn more:
- Quantum Computing
- Artificial Intelligence
- Blockchain

content.title: Resource- and Waste Management
content.subtitle: Circular Hub
content.description:
The Village functions as a circular and zero-waste economy in which ressource loops (food, material, water, energy) are being closed. All areas of the infrastructure system are connected to the “Internet of Nature” - in which the health state of the ecosystem is being monitored in real-time, ensuring that certain limits of resource extraction and carbon emissions are not exceeded and resources remain in the cycle as long as possible.

Learn more: 
- Closed-loop System
- Environmental Monitoring

content.title: Construction
content.subtitle: Construction Site
content.description:
The people live in carbon-neutral, circular and energy-positive homes, built with sustainable materials, such as timber, stone, clay, earth-based mixtures, bamboo or recycled concrete. While construction involved hard manual labor in the past, today large components of the buildings can be 3D-printed or pre-fabricated & assembled on site.

Learn more: 
- Sustainable Building Materials
- Life Cycle Design
- Digital Fabrication & 3D-Printing
- Modular and Pre-fabricated Buildings
- Biophilic Architecture
- Digital Twins

content.title: Retail
content.subtitle: Marketplace
content.description:
While there were large shopping malls in the past, most things can be showcased in the virtual space. There are just a few boutiques left that sell high-quality and sustainable products. 

Learn more: 
- Circular E-Commerce
- Sustainable Fashion

content.title: Manufacturing
content.subtitle: Fabrication Lab
content.description:
In the Fabrication Lab various objects, such as machinery, tools, furniture and everyday items can be manufactured and repaired on site using 3d-printers, robots and other advanced manufacturing machines. Most objects are made of local biodegradable & recyclable materials.

Learn more: 
- Sustainable Materials
- Life Cycle Design
- 3D-Printing
- Robotics
- IoT

content.title: Governance
content.subtitle: Governance Metaverse
content.description:
The governance system enables a high level of local self-determination and freedom. A digital deliberation- and voting infrastructure leverages the collective intelligence in a more fluid and effective way. 

Learn more: 
- Subsidiarity Principle
- Digital Democracy
- Policy Simulations
